Detailed Description

Objects of the is class represent communication events.

They get passed up to the application through dispatch handlers (see DispatchHandler).

void Hypertable::Event::load_header ( int  sd,
const uint8_t *  buf,
size_t  len 
) [inline]

Loads header object from serialized buffer.

This method also sets the thread_group member.

Parameters:
sd socket descriptor from which the event was generated (used for thread_group)
buf buffer containing serialized header
len length of buffer

Definition at line 77 of file Event.h.

String Hypertable::Event::to_str (  ) 

Generates a one-line string representation of the event.

For example: 

   Event: type=MESSAGE id=2 gid=0 header_len=16 total_len=20 \
   from=127.0.0.1:38040 ...

Definition at line 108 of file Event.h.

uint64_t Hypertable::Event::thread_group

Thread group to which this message belongs.

Used to serialize messages destined for the same object. This value is created in the constructor and is the combination of the socked descriptor from which the message was read and the gid field in the message header: 

 thread_group = ((uint64_t)sd << 32) | header->gid;
If the gid is zero, then the thread_group member is also set to zero

Definition at line 119 of file Event.h.

Type Hypertable::Event::type

Type of event.

Can take one of values CONNECTION_ESTABLISHED, DISCONNECT, MESSAGE, ERROR, or TIMER
